items.title: Adamu, Arthur & Mvuka join Celtic on loan
items.summary: Celtic have signed Austria striker Junior Adamu from Bundesliga club Freiburg, Brentford centre-half Benjamin Arthur and Lorient winger Joel Mvuka, all on loan to the end of the season.

items.title: BTS Announces Livestream Concert and Feature-Length Documentary to Air on Netflix
items.summary: BTS is mounting a big comeback with the announcement of both a livestreamed performance and a feature-length documentary, both airing on Netflix in partnership with Hybe. items.title: Just seven signings - the Premier League's quiet deadline day
items.summary: A low-key transfer deadline day ended with the fewest Premier League deals completed in a winter window. BBC Sport looks at the spending that was done, and examines why there was so little activity.

items.title: Adobe Animate is shutting down next month
items.summary: Adobe is pulling the plug on Adobe Animate. Users have until March 1st, 2027 (or March 1st, 2029 for enterâ€¦

items.title: Rashford wants to stay at Barca - Tuesday's gossip
items.summary: Marcus Rashford is eyeing a permanent Barcelona switch, Raheem Sterling rejects a Bundesliga move, Tottenham miss out on Maghnes Akliouche, plus more.

items.title: 'Unacceptable' - Parker fumes at passive Burnley side
items.summary: Scott Parker believes his Burnley "never gave themselves a chance" against Sunderland, as the side failed to manage a shot on target during the game.

items.title: Intel returns to boxed workstation CPUs with Xeon 600 â€” Granite Rapids WS delivers up to 86 cores, 4TB of memory, and 128 PCIe 5 lanes
items.summary: Intel is returning to desktop workstations with Xeon 600. Granite Rapids WS CPUs deliver up to 61% better multi-threaded performance, according to Intel, sporting up to 86 cores and 4TB of memory.

items.title: Galaxy S26 Ultra's S Pen and official accessories leaked
items.summary: Last week, official-looking renders of the Galaxy S26 lineup surfaced online, showcasing the phones from multiple angles. Now, official accessories for the series have leaked, along with the S Pen for the Galaxy S26 Ultra. According to the leak, the Galaxy S26 Ultraâ€™s S Pen will be offered only in â€¦

items.title: Samsung, SK Hynix, and Micron team up to block memory hoarding â€” prices might rise faster, but it could help encourage increased supply long term
items.summary: Samsung, SK Hynix, and Micron are teaming up to block memory hoarding.

items.title: Ikeaâ€™s next cheap Bluetooth speaker is a playful purple mouse
items.summary: Following the debut of its $10 Kallsup Bluetooth speakers at CES 2026, Ikea is introducing another wireless speaker with a playful design and an affordable price tag. The Grejsimojs Portable Bluetooth speaker probably isn't going to wow audiophiles, but it's designed to look like a little purple moâ€¦

items.title: Firefox is adding a switch to turn AI features off
items.summary: Unlike many of the companies stuffing AI into their browsers, Mozilla will soon give you a way to turn all of these features off. An update coming on February 24th will add a new "AI control" option to Firefox's settings menu, allowing you to disable or enable the browser's individual AI features, â€¦

items.title: iPhone Fold to pack Apple's biggest smartphone battery yet, here's how large it will be
items.summary: Apple's iPhone Fold is coming out later this year, the rumor consensus agrees. The device will have a very different form factor to what we've seen in the Android world, and according to a new rumor from China today, it will also come with the biggest battery Apple has ever put in a smartphone. Bacâ€¦

items.title: Phillips joins Sheffield United on loan - can he revive career?
items.summary: Sheffield United sign Manchester City midfielder Kalvin Phillips on loan for the remainder of the season.

items.title: Oppo Reno15 review
Skater cannot perform to Minions music at Olympics

items.summary: Cristiano Ronaldo's future at Al-Nassr is plunged into doubt after he is left out of their squad for Monday's Saudi Pro League game against Al-Riyadh.

items.summary: The Trump administration will soon launch a $12 billion critical minerals stockpile designed to insulate U.S. manufacturing from supply disruptions tied to Chinaâ€™s dominance of mining and refining.

items.title: Kerolin hat-trick sees Man City crush Chelsea title hopes
items.summary: A hat-trick from Kerolin saw Manchester City sweep Chelsea aside in an emphatic victory, giving them a dominant lead at the top of the WSL table.

items.title: Tennis immortality at 22 - Alcaraz's historic win
items.summary: The key statistics and numbers behind Carlos Alcaraz's historic Australian Open victory.

items.title: Former Google engineer convicted of stealing GPU and TPU trade secrets for 'Chinese interests' â€” tried to raise funding for his own start-up
items.summary: A federal jury in San Francisco has convicted a former Google engineer of stealing confidential AI infrastructure data and transferring it to benefit Chinese interests.

items.title: Chinese researchers discover new salty cooling solution that can drop temperatures by more than 50 degrees Celsius in seconds â€” depressurizing saturated fluid triggers massive amounts of heat transfer
items.summary: Chinese researchers developed a salt solution that absorbs large amounts of heat when depressurized, making it a potential substitute to traditional, power intensive cooling solutions used in data centers.

items.title: Save 47% on Samsung's 32-inch 1440p 180Hz gaming monitor as it drops to its cheapest price ever â€” Get your hands on the Odyssey G5 G50D for just $229 on Amazon
items.summary: New OLED and Mini-LED monitors sure look enticing, but they often come with eye-watering demands and sometimes you just need something simple. Samsung's G50D is about as straightforward as it gets with a 32-inch Fast IPS panel featuring 1440p resolution and 180 Hz refresh rate that supports both G-â€¦

items.title: SpaceX formalizes plan to build 1 million satellite Orbital Data Center System â€” FCC filing sketches out plans, but over-packed orbits could be limiting factor
items.summary: SpaceX said in an FCC filing that it plans to launch a million satellites to serve as AI data centers that would deliver 100 gigawatts of compute capacity.

items.title: Asus ROG Strix GS-BE18000 Wi-Fi 7 gaming router â€” Good overall performance and a wealth of LAN ports
items.summary: The Asus ROG Strix GS-BE18000 hits all the right notes when it comes to hardware and software, and brings the performance to back it up on the 6 GHz and 5 GHz bands.

items.title: Researcher builds bizarre 128-byte USB drive the size of a dinner plate using ancient pre-semiconductor magnetic core memory technology â€” data disappears once it is read, requiring special handling
items.summary: A computing enthusiast has assembled one of the most bizarre low-capacity USB drives we have ever seen.

items.title: Happy tennis, serious name - how history-maker Alcaraz clinched career Grand Slam
items.summary: Before Carlos Alcaraz became the youngest man to complete the career Grand Slam, he was simply Carlitos from Murcia. This is his story.

items.title: Open source IDE-ATAPI drive emulator launches for vintage computers â€” drop-in 3.5-inch bay solution can save oodles of optical and HDD images to a microSD
items.summary: PicoIDE is touted as 'an open source IDE/ATAPI drive emulator for vintage computers.'

items.title: Shanghai scientists create computer chip in fiber thinner than a human hair, yet can withstand crushing force of 15.6 tons â€” fiber packs 100,000 transistors per centimeter
items.summary: Researchers say they have built a computer chip in a flexible fiber that is thinner than an average human hair.

items.title: Intel ties AMD for most reliable CPUs in 2025 system builder report â€” Nvidia's Founders Edition GPUs dominate with the lowest failure rates
items.summary: Puget System just released its annual reliability report for 2025, noting which computer components suffered the least number of failures in testing and deployment.

items.title: Malicious OpenClaw â€˜skillâ€™ targets crypto users on ClawHub â€” 14 malicious skills were uploaded to ClawHub last month
items.summary: Security researchers are warning that the growing ecosystem around â€˜OpenClaw,â€™ the self-hosted AI assistant formerly known as Clawdbot, has already become a target for malware distribution.

items.title: The Intel 286 CPU was introduced on this day in 1982 â€” 16-bit x86 chip introduced protected mode memory, and would power the IBM PC/AT and a tidal wave of clones
items.summary: Today, in 1982, Intel introduced its â€œshowstoppingâ€ 80286 processor. This 16-bit fully x86 software compatible CPU delivered some major performance and architectural advancements over the 8086 and 8088, and would continue to be produced and feature in PC systems well into the 1990s.

items.title: Japanese art museum intros $15 bookmarks made from PCBs â€” the PCB traces form a miniature Tokyo Metro map
items.summary: The Tokyo Metropolitan Art Museum has added some beautiful PCB Metro Map bookmarks to its souvenir store.

items.title: Why 2026 could be GB's most successful Winter Olympics
items.summary: A record-breaking Winter Olympics could be on the horizon for Team GB - but who could win the medals in Milan-Cortina?

items.title: Hennessy edges win over Boutell for eighth-straight victory
items.summary: Francesca Hennessy claims her eighth-straight victory as she beats Ellie Bouttell on points at London's Copper Box Arena.

items.title: External disc drive now a mere $9.99 on Woot â€”  Access any CD or DVD with a modern USB-C interface at 55% off
items.summary: If you're looking for a cheap but straightforward solution to access your old media locked behind an outdated storage medium, or just want to respect tradition and hold onto DVD/CDs, this external disc drive is the perfect tool for you. For just $10, you can read and write all your old discs with aâ€¦

items.title: Wisconsin towns reportedly signed secret NDAs for billion-dollar data center deals â€” Microsoft and Meta hide behind confidential agreements
items.summary: At least four Wisconsin municipalities are understood to have signed underhanded nondisclosure agreements concerning new data centers while negotiating their development.

items.title: RTX 5070 OLED gaming laptop slashed to $1,294 in Lenovo's blowout sale â€” premium 1440p 280 Hz OLED monitor drops down to $485
items.summary: We spotted some outstanding Saturday deals on Lenovo's website, including powerful gaming laptops and high-end gaming displays.

items.title: Gaming market melts down after Google reveals new AI game design tool â€” Project Genie crashes stocks for Roblox, Nintendo, CD Projekt Red, and more
items.summary: Google's Project Genie can generate games using the company's Genie 3 model, which is trained on prompts from Gemini. It's an experimental tool that doesn't even create fully playable games, but it was still enough to shiver the timbers of video game shareholders. Unity saw a 20% drop in its stock â€¦

items.title: Nvidia's plan to invest $100 billion in OpenAI appears unlikely â€” Jensen reportedly criticizing OpenAI's business decisions in private discussions
items.summary: Nvidia and OpenAI are still in talks about the $100-billion MOU the two parties signed in September 2025, and it seems that deal will be modified for a much "smaller" sum of tens of billions of dollars.

items.title: Maingear brings back the 90s nostalgia with old-school pre-built PCs with RTX 5090 and Ryzen 9 9950X3D â€” limited edition Retro98 PCs are available now
items.summary: Maingear is offering a high-end retro gaming PC based on the Silverstone FLOP02 "beige box" case, with a limited run of 38 units.

items.title: How to save memory in Windows â€” RAM is expensive; hereâ€™s how to maximize the RAM that you already have!
items.summary: As RAM prices soar, we show you how to do more with less RAM!

items.title: SanDisk stock price jumps by 1,500% in almost a year â€” growth fueled by strong demand from AI data centers and enterprise clients, consumer revenue also up by 52%
items.summary: SanDisk stock price went from $36 to nearly $590 per share in just a year, driven by a seven-fold increase in profits year-over-year, hitting $803 million.

items.title: Duke Nukem 3D turns 30 years old, brought swaggering FPS action to real-world environments â€” 1996 release broke the Doom clone mold while adding humor and personality
items.summary: Duke Nukem 3D smashed the 3D FPS Doom clone mold in 1996.

items.title: Biwin Black Opal NV7400 2TB SSD Review: Another Arrow in Biwinâ€™s Quiver
